title: 1.2m WiseTech shares sold after short attack
text:
It took some $1 billion in lost market capitalisation before the ASX's surveillance team put WiseTech on ice.

At 11:37am on Thursday, J Capital Research accused the $10 billion ASX tech titan of overstating its profits and revenues. At 12:18pm, the ASX put WiseTech into a trading pause while it sought further information from the company. A full trading halt was granted at 1.41pm.

In the meantime, 1,211,258 shares changed hands according to Bloomberg, with the share price sinking as much as 12.6 per cent from where it was before J Capital's report.

An ASX spokesman said "changes in price or volume of shares traded must reach a certain materiality (which differs from company to company) before ASX takes the market away". In this case, "ASX has followed its established procedures for matters of this kind, which include engaging with the company and liaising with ASIC".

While WiseTech prepares its response to what J Capital has alleged so far, J Capital has in turn flagged a drip feed of further releases. Extended turbulence seems guaranteed.

And only those sitting in front of their terminals or with their brokers on speed dial are likely to have avoided it.
